title: How many countries teach English as a second language in school? - Quora
tags: Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)

response.answer_text: My guess is that schools in most countries offer ESL English had become the second language of choice around the world, although there are probably many more native speakers of Chinese. English has been, until the recent Trump presidency, the language of choice for business, all airlines communicate in English, literate people around the world speak and understand it. Many countries in Africa and the Pacific region speak creoles of English that may not be recognizable to everyone, but are, in fact, very closely related to English. One of the reasons that English has become so popular, at least partly, because it is so flexible. When it needs a new word, it often incorporates the word from some other language. The origins of many English words are from Chinese, Hindi, and other languages. Also, because English is relatively uninflected (no gender in nouns, fewer endings, simpler constructions) it is easier to learn than many other languages. While some people (mostly English teachers and language snobs) are sticklers for “correct” usage and grammar, most people are happy to listen to what you have to say and to respond. In other countries, when you try to speak their language, people correct you before they answer you. Here’s a list of nine countries that pay the most for teachers of English as a Second Language: The 9 Highest-Paying Countries Where You Can Teach English Abroad Good luck in your search.
